verses.verse: A wise <S%H2450><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> listens to his father <S%H1><s%>'s instruction, <S%H4148><s%> but a scoffer <S%H3887><s%> doesn't <S%H8085><s%> listen to rebuke. <S%H1606><s%>

The soul <S%H5315><s%> of the sluggard <S%H6102><s%> desires, <S%H183><s%> and has nothing, <S%H5315><s%> but the desire of the diligent <S%H2742><s%> shall be fully satisfied. <S%H1878><s%>

The light <S%H216><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> shines brightly, <S%H8055><s%> but the lamp <S%H5216><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is snuffed out. <S%H1846><s%>
Pride <S%H2087><s%> only breeds <S%H5414><s%> quarrels, <S%H4683><s%> but with ones who take advice <S%H3289><s%> is wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
Wealth <S%H1952><s%> gained dishonestly <S%H1892><s%> dwindles <S%H4591><s%> away, <S%H6908><s%> but he who gathers by hand <S%H3027><s%> makes it grow. <S%H7235><s%>
Hope <S%H8431><s%> deferred <S%H4900><s%> makes the heart <S%H3820><s%> sick, <S%H2470><s%> but when longing <S%H8378><s%> is fulfilled, <S%H935><s%> it is a tree <S%H6086><s%> of life. <S%H2416><s%>
Whoever despises <S%H936><s%> instruction <S%H1697><s%> will pay <S%H2254><s%> for it, <S%H3373><s%> but he who respects a command <S%H4687><s%> will be rewarded. <S%H7999><s%>

Good <S%H2896><s%> understanding <S%H7922><s%> wins <S%H5414><s%> favor; <S%H2580><s%> but the way <S%H1870><s%> of the unfaithful <S%H898><s%> is hard. <S%H386><s%>
Every prudent <S%H6175><s%> man acts <S%H6213><s%> from knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> but a fool <S%H3684><s%> exposes <S%H6566><s%> folly. <S%H200><s%>
A wicked <S%H7563><s%> messenger <S%H4397><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> into trouble, <S%H7451><s%> but a trustworthy <S%H529><s%> envoy <S%H6735><s%> gains healing. <S%H4832><s%>
Poverty <S%H7389><s%> and shame <S%H7036><s%> come to him who refuses <S%H6544><s%> discipline, <S%H4148><s%> but he who heeds <S%H8104><s%> correction <S%H4148><s%> shall be honored. <S%H3513><s%>
Longing <S%H8378><s%> fulfilled <S%H1961><s%> is sweet <S%H6149><s%> to the soul, <S%H5315><s%> but fools <S%H3684><s%> detest <S%H8441><s%> turning <S%H5493><s%> from evil. <S%H7451><s%>

An abundance <S%H7230><s%> of food <S%H400><s%> is in poor <S%H7218><s%> people <S%H5215><s%>'s fields, but <S%H3808><s%> injustice <S%H4941><s%> sweeps it <S%H3426><s%> away. <S%H5595><s%>

The righteous <S%H6662><s%> one <S%H5315><s%> eats <S%H398><s%> to the satisfying <S%H7648><s%> of his soul, <S%H5315><s%> but the belly <S%H990><s%> of the wicked goes hungry. <S%H7563><s%>
